intro: Zieria smithii var. macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved zieria, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and glossy, and the species is noted for its ornamental value in gardens. It is a relatively low-maintenance plant that thrives in full sun to partial shade.
